title: Wireless System Automation and Test Engineer
summary:
Do you have a passion for taking on big challenges? Do you love pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Wireless Hardware group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world. On this team, you’ll help improve the performance of our products through innovative system-on-chip designs. You and your team will build platform architecture that paves the way for all-new experiences, including the ones that allow people to take advantage of our innovations in sensor technology. Together, our goal is to ensure nothing stands in the way of our customers’ connections with their devices. Join us and help build world-renowned wireless systems that connect customers to their world like never before.

In this technical role, you will be responsible for automation development and characterization of powerful wireless SoC products. You will also lead the test development efforts for the characterization and regression at the center of a silicon design group!
description:
-  Design and lead Python-based test automation for bring-up, characterization, and regression.
-  Implement golden calibration algorithms for wireless transceivers in automation infrastructure.
-  Characterize algorithms on real silicon alongside PHY, MAC, RFIC, and digital circuit designers.
-  Develop and implement test plans; collect and analyze test results; identify, root-cause, and debug issues.
-  Champion the test campaigns through the bring-up, tuning, characterization, and other phases of post-silicon chip development.
key_qualifications:
This is an individual technical contributor role that requires industry experience with test automation, bringing up, and productization of wireless communication systems.
Deep understanding of communication theory and radio calibration algorithms (such as modulation and RF impairment mitigation)
Extensive experience using and understanding of the theory of operation of lab equipment (spectrum analyzer, signal generator, network analyzer, power meter).
Extensive experience developing test automation including equipment drivers, debug tools, automation scripts, database interfaces, and reporting tools.
Knowledge in existing wireless communication protocols: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax/be, 802.11ad/ay, Bluetooth/BLE, or cellular technologies.
Extensive experience with Python, Shell scripting, and/or C/C++
Experience with automation infrastructure development (traceability, repeatability) and related tools (GIT, CI, database, reporting tools)
education_experience: Minimum qualification is BS+10 years of relevant experience. MS or PhD preferred.
